body.name: Instant Vortex Plus 6QT Air Fryer with Odor Erase Technology, 6-in-1 Functions that Crisps, Roasts, Broils, Dehydrates, Bakes & Reheats, 100+ In-App Recipes, from the Makers of Instant Pot, Black
features: 6-IN-1 FUNCTIONALITY: Air fry, roast, broil, bake, reheat and dehydrate
WATCH YOUR FOOD COOK: ClearCook window and internal light to easily monitor cooking progress without opening the basket
ODOR ERASE TECHNOLOGY: Built-in, replaceable air filters remove odors during cooking to reduce lingering cooking smells.
EvenCrisp TECHNOLOGY: Advanced technology that drives air flow top down for a perfect golden finish and crispy, tender results every time!
ONE-TOUCH SMART PROGRAMS: Customizable programs for one-touch wings, roasted veggies, garlicky potatoes, cookies, cinnamon buns and more!
FAST PREHEATING: Little to no preheating time, from frozen to golden in minutes! Create gourmet meals with the versatility of a temperature range of 95 to 400° F.
EASY CLEAN-UP: Non-stick, dishwasher safe air fry basket and tray.
A KITCHEN MUST HAVE: Perfect for quick delicious meals, preparing side dishes, appetizers, wings and more. Great addition to any kitchen; perfect for 4-6 servings.
DISCOVER AMAZING RECIPES: Download our free Instant Pot app, so you can create quick new favorites and prepare delicious meals, available iOS and Android.
SAFETY FEATURES: Built-in safety features like Overheat Protection, auto-off and more to keep your mind at ease.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This appliance is so easy to use, instructions are straight forward, and its easy to clean. Trays come clean with just soapy water and a sponge. If you have a postage stamp sized kitchen, its worth the counter space as it is compact in size but can still roast a whole chicken. I like that the beep isn't ear piercing when its done but still loud enough to be heard. I have a tiny kitchen with an apartment sized stove and this machine makes it much easier to stage food to cook so everything is served at the same temp using fewer pots, pans, and dishes. Used in tandem with an Instant Pot and an Instant Slow Cooker I'll likely not have to use the stove terribly often. So worth it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I never run out of inspiration for delicious meals and snacks with...
reviews.reviewText: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐I recently purchased the Instant Vortex Plus 6QT Air Fryer with Odor Erase Technology, and I must say, it has exceeded all my expectations! This appliance is an absolute game-changer in my kitchen.Firstly, the 6-in-1 functionality is remarkable. It crisps, roasts, broils, dehydrates, bakes, and reheats with unparalleled ease. Whether I'm whipping up a batch of crispy fries, roasting vegetables to perfection, or dehydrating fruits for a healthy snack, this air fryer does it all flawlessly.The Odor Erase Technology is truly a godsend. No more lingering smells from frying or cooking - this feature ensures that my kitchen stays fresh and odor-free, even after cooking the most flavorful dishes.Another aspect that I love about this air fryer is the extensive collection of in-app recipes. With over 100 recipes to choose from, I never run out of inspiration for delicious meals and snacks. The recipes are easy to follow and yield mouthwatering results every time.Furthermore, the build quality of the Instant Vortex Plus is top-notch. It feels sturdy and well-made, assuring me of its durability and longevity.Overall, I can't recommend the Instant Vortex Plus 6QT Air Fryer enough. It's versatile, convenient, and produces restaurant-quality results. If you're looking to revolutionize your cooking experience, look no further than this fantastic appliance from the makers of Instant Pot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Addition to My Kitchen (Instant Vortex Pro 10 Quart)
reviews.reviewText: I read a lot of strange reviews about this air fryer. I decided to try it anyway. I've had it since the end of November (little over 3 months) and I am very happy with my purchase. I use the bake feature to reheat foods wrapped in aluminum foil, I've done pork roasts on the rotisserie, and I've used the air fryer for chicken breasts and steak. It's all turned out great! When I did the pork roast on the spit, I did feel I needed to cook it a bit longer wrapped up in the oven because I like meat that falls apart and I had a rub on it with sugar in the rub. Boneless skinless chicken breasts are nice and juicy and not dry when done in the air fryer. I do suggest getting a meat thermometer so you don't overcook it. I do homemade chicken nuggets in it and I even cooked some small meat loaves in it. It also does wonderful chicken wings from frozen.The trays are a decent size and you can fit a good bit of food in it. The drip tray in the bottom is nice so cleanup is pretty quick and easy. Some people complained about the door coming off. The door does easily remove by pulling up on it and wiggling it for cleaning. I have had the door misalign if I pull on it the wrong way but it easily slips right back into place. I'd rather have it removable so I can clean it. I did purchase some small silicone mats to lay on the door when I pull the trays out and turn the food so you don't get drips all over the door. I really like the light feature too so you can check your food without opening the door. I feel like it was well worth the money I spent on it and so far am happy with it's convenience and the speed that it cooks and reheats food. I did have a 3 quart round air fryer with a basket before this and I'm glad I upgraded. The other one (the basket one) was my first air fryer that I had about 3 years and this is my 2nd. Like I said, well worth the upgrade and much easier to clean!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice Multi Purpose Oven, But ...
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE (10/31): The door comment I mentioned below turned out to be a non-issue. I am satisfied that the door operates as it should. I just need to be mindful to use two hands to steady the oven when I close it. I do think the oven temp runs a little hot. But, I haven't got a oven thermostat yet, to test it. The smell from the first couple uses has disappeared. Otherwise, this oven is a very good value. And it looks and feels like it will hold up over time. Thx 😊==========MY EARLIER COMMENTS:I received the oven last week, so this is an early review. As my subject line says, this is very nice oven and good value for the price ($120). But there's a couple of qualifiers to this early review that I am evaluating.First, the door - which feels solid and well made - doesn't always close correctly. It closes askew about 25-30% of the time when closing it with ONE hand. If I put my second hand on top of the oven and then close it, it lines up properly almost all the time. It seems to be something I have to be cognizant of when I use the oven. But it does leave me with a question on how well the mechanism will hold up over time. More TBD.Second, I not sure about the accuracy of its temperature control. I baked a frozen (half) pizza the other day - a good quality pizza at that. It got pretty crispy on the middle rack, after 9 minutes at 400°F (the oven max temp). The instructions said for 11-12 min at 425°. I am going to use a temp probe later, to check it's temperature accuracy.Lastly as others have commented, it gives off a chemically type smell during the first uses, which I could also taste in the food (I've used the oven 3 times). That said, I am going to "season" the oven by running it at max temp for 15 min (as someone else suggested). I suspect that will resolve the smell issue.TBC ... I will update this post in a couple weeks.
This works incredibly. We love it and highly recommend it.

This air fryer has changed our lives. It is easy to use with simple controls. It cooks everything to perfection and it is simple to clean. The basket size is perfect for our family of three and the interior light is super helpful. We really love this air fryer compared to our previous unit and I wish I could give one to everyone I know.

reviews.reviewTitle: I’m glad I didn’t return it because of reviews I read
reviews.reviewText: I was going to return this because of a lot of cons i read on the reviews plus I don’t have a lot of counter or storage space but I’m sick of feeding my son and bf fried foods cooked in oil especially my son, who loves fried foods.My take on the cons I read1. Plastic smell- when I opened the air fryer for the first time, there’s a wiff of plastic smell. Per the cleaning instructions, I wiped the inside with damp towel and dried it. I did this several times until I can no longer smell plastic when I stick my nose in it. I also washed the 2 trays and grease tray with warm water and diswashing soap and dried it with clean towel. I ran an empty cycle using Airfryer for 20min and almost immediately, there’s a strong plastic smell filling my kitchen. I did 2 empty cycles for 20min each and I’ve been smelling the vent behind it for plastic smell. During the 2nd cycle, the plastic smell wasn’t as strong as the first cycle. I used it to cook food for the first time after few hours and the food did not smell or taste plastic.Bottomline for the plastic smell, I think cleaning the inside with damp towel and washing the trays really helped get rid of the smell in my opinion. I ran 2 empty cycles for 20min each and the plastic smell was gone.2. Touchscreen not sensitive enough- for this one, I don’t really have a problem with it. Mine is working great. No need to touch it multiples times or even hard.3. Too loud- I’m not sure if its because I always have Grey’s Anatomy playing on my tv whenever I ran my airfryer but I don’t think mine is as loud as some people mentioned.4. Beep too quite- Yes, the beep indeed is quite, but my solution to that is just setting my phone alarm.Food taste so much better and flavourful compared to conventional oven cooked foods.I have not tried the basket or the rotisserie but I’m excited to cook lechon belly in it soon.Overall, I’m very happy with this. This is my very first big appliance purchase since my bf and I started living at our own place. It will help me with dinner especially because I work the graveyard shift and I can cook my son all the fried food his little heart wants.
Rápida, increíble la ventana para ver los alimentos. Fácil de limpiar y usar. Evita olores al freír pescado o cortes de carne.
I have no complaints, the product works as advertised
